titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus Anniversary Commemoration.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Mr. Gilchrest asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules.
Amendment SP 449 proposed by Senator Smith.
Amendment SP 449 not agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/8/1995--Introduced. Authorizes the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus to sponsor a public event, with circus elephants and performers, on the Capitol grounds on April 3, 1995, or on such other date as the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate may jointly designate. Directs that such event be free of charge to the public and arranged not to interfere with the needs of the Congress and that Ringling Bros. shall assume full responsibility for all expenses and liabilities incident to all activities associated with the event.
